document_title: Urinary tract infections during pregnancy: Causes and treatments
subsection_name: viem-duong-tiet-nieu-khi-mang-thai.json_5_How to prevent urinary tract infections for pregnant women
subsection_content:
To avoid urinary tract infections during pregnancy, which affects the health of mother and baby, pregnant women should follow the following tips to help prevent the disease effectively:
Drink enough water every day according to your weight and living conditions; Clean the private area with a mild solution and use a cotton towel to dry from front to back; Urinate frequently to expel water from the bladder; Wear loose, comfortable clothes made of sweat-absorbent material; Limit bathing in tubs; Prevent urinary tract infections after sex by cleaning the urethral area before and after sex; Avoid alcohol, spicy foods, and drinks containing caffeine; Follow a balanced, scientific lifestyle to improve the body's resistance; Urine testing before pregnancy to prevent asymptomatic urinary tract infections.
